results.title: Day care & the pre-school experience
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Overviews child care in modern industrialised societies and compares it to child care in hunter-gatherer and agricultural societies, emphasising the effect of child care on children.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Day at night: I.M. Pei
results.brief_description: Interview with leading U.S. architect and designer, I.M. Pei. Covers his views on the Beaux Arts system under which he trained, his reasons for feeling that an elitist and exclusive view of architecture is no longer valid. He stresses the importance of urban housing in turning cities from places of commerce to areas offering their inhabitants a genuine richness of life

results.title: Day and night
results.creator_credit: Franz Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and Margaret Simpson
results.brief_description: An explanation of the occurrence of day and night by means of experiments with a rotating model globe. The film deals with the rotation of the earth on its tilted axis; the sun as a source of light to the earth; the cause of day and night; the movement of the earth, with its tilted axis, round the sun, and the effect of this tilting on the length of day and night in the four seasons of the year.

results.title: Dax's Case
results.brief_description: This documentary raised vital questions about a patient’s right to choose whether to live or die, and about the role of the medical and legal profession. In 1973 Dax Cowart, a former air force pilot, was the victim of an explosion which left him blind, disfigured and suffering excruciating pain from severe burns. Despite persistent pleas to be allowed to die, Dax was kept alive. Now, leading a full life, he still maintains that he should have been allowed to die.

results.title: Dax
results.creator_credit: Antony Barrier and Mary Glasgow Audio-Visual
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of two teenage girls who arrive for a few days holiday at Dax, a thermal station in the Pyrenees Department of Lands. The narration and conversation are in simple, easy to understand French.

results.title: Dawn of the solar age
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: A survey of current methods of, and projects for, harnessing solar energy is presented in an attempt to answer the question - when oil supplies end, can the world’s industries be run by solar energy?

results.title: Davy Jones' locker
results.brief_description: From the animated series “Willie Whopper’s Adventures”, the story of Willie Whopper, a little boy with a big imagination. Willie tangles with denizens of the deep, including a vast and menacing Poseidon figure and a drunken pirate (Davy Jones), who swills hooch while slamming his peg-leg stump on the deck of his room. Lots of sea-creature sight gags, too.

results.title: David Williamson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian playwrights speak”.
Without a question Australia’s most popular and successful playwright is David Williamson. He has analysed and mythologised Australia in thirteen professionally performed plays.

results.title: David Lean: a self portrait
results.creator_credit: Thomas Craven Film Corporation and Thomas Craven
results.brief_description: A comprehensive documentary made in collaboration with the noted director at work on the set, on location, and in the editing room, as he explains his viewpoint about the film and his method of work. Illustrates with excerpt from several of Lean’s films, which together have won a number of awards. Includes interviews with Sam Spiegel who produced some of Lean’s early films and Robert Bolt who wrote the scripts for Lean’s last three films.
